ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Surprisingly, we spent most of the semester talking about what makes good architectural design. We spent maybe 2 classes talking about UI. We learned a lot about famous architects, writers, and artists, and practically nothing about famous computer scientists except for the opinions of Professor Gelernter.
chairs, churches, and ui
none
I learned a lot about design principles and their origins.
Absolutely nothing.
Almost nothing
none
Architecture design
History and best practice for UI design

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: interesting lectures
The course could be improved by being able to turn in assignments through Canvas instead of email.
The class has no strengths. There is no point to the class. The prof just rambled about his right wing theories such as denying climate change and evolution.
You would not believe the level of disorganization and lack of material.

- professor was very unresponsive (doesn't reply to emails, if you follow-up in-person, he'll say he'll get back to you via email and never does, doesn't matter how urgent the request is)
- very little grade transparency; grade is mostly qualitative, not quantitative
- professor spent every single class talking about things entirely unrelated to User Interface (mostly architecture/art history, some denial of the theory evolution, some climate change denial). Only thing remotely related was the mention of additive/subtractive colors, but still didn't explain anything further.

The course is mainly about architecture design which broader my understanding to anesthetics. However, the course title is user interface. I think the course is not highly related to the core concept as the title shows.

Strength: The assignments were very interesting. 
Weakness:  The lectures were not very organized.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you need an extra CS credit in a heavy workload semester, take this course. Honestly, I enjoyed Professor Gelernter's teaching, even though it had nothing to do with the course content. I learned a lot about architectural design and art history, and it was quite interesting. Though, if you're expecting to learn about UI design, don't take the class.
no
Yes, the course material was enjoyable, but only if you have an appreciation for the arts and want to learn about how artistic principles apply to website design.
I would not this class is a waste of time and you may not get a good grade.
If you dont care about getting bad grade for no reason and are interested in hearing unqualified reasons to not believe in evolution and climate change, sure
absolutely not, under no circumstances should any student take this course
Yes, if the student want to save school time for off campus activities. For knowledge gaining, my answer would be no.
Not really, because the lectures were not very informative.
